author: Emma Ankrah
title: Finance Minister cautions manufacturers, industries to stop hoarding dollars
text: The Minister for Finance, Dr Mohammed Amin Adam has sent a warning to manufacturers and industries, accusing them of contributing to the depreciation of the cedi. The local currency has suffered a significant fall against major foreign currencies in recent times, reaching as high as GHS15.59 pesewas to a dollar. At an engagement with manufacturers on Thursday, August 8, the Finance Minister said the hoarding of dollars, and the dollarization of the economy have contributed significantly to the fall of the cedi. “There some companies, they manufacture, they sell, and they accept cash, physical cash from their sales. And when they have done that, they don't keep the cash in the banks, they go and convert it into US dollars and keep the dollars. That contributes to the forex problem you're talking about. We need to check that,” he stated. Dr Amin Adam cited an instance where an oil processing company attempted to hoard dollars, significantly impacting the Cedi's value. He explained that the “company deposited $15 million in a bank but lacked even a third of the required Ghana cedis to support a $50 million demand. This action caused the cedi's depreciation when it was trading at 13 cedis to the dollar, leaving the market in a precarious state.” He therefore appealed to the manufacturers to help curb the cedi from depreciating. “Where the demand for the dollar exceeds the supply of the dollar what do you expect to happen to the price of the dollar in which case the cedi? It will depreciate. So I'm appealing to you also talk to your members to support the efforts of government,” he said. He also urged the manufacturers to support the government’s efforts to transform the economy to avert the possibility of any civil action in Ghana. Latest Stories - Mozambique ex-finance minister convicted in US over ‘tuna bonds’ scandal 25 mins - Driver jailed for death of Ecuador politician’s daughter 2 hours - Columbia says 3 deans resign over ‘antisemitic tropes’ in texts 2 hours - Somalia’s cabinet approves bill for universal suffrage 2 hours - New bodycam footage shows moments before Trump rally shooting 2 hours - Absa Bank East Legon branch upgraded for Premier, Prestige, and Business banking 3 hours - School Feeding Programme goes digital 3 hours - South Africa to impose VAT on low-value parcels to help clothing industry compete 3 hours - ‘I knew the people I was dealing with, so I expected it’ – Charlotte Osei on her removal 3 hours - I received death threats during my tenure as EC Chair – Charlotte Osei 4 hours - SSNIT won’t bow to hasty decisions on underperforming hotels – Kofi Bosompem Osafo-Maafo 4 hours - Burkina Faso security ministry urges citizens to report each other 5 hours - Ghana opens first gold refinery after centuries of mining 5 hours - I miss playing for England – Sterling 5 hours - Saboba overlord calls for dialogue to resolve Zogbie clash that claimed 4 lives 5 hours

author: @indianexpress
title: Selena Gomez developed a 'face rash' after kissing Benny Blanco for the first time: 'I was so disgusting and repulsive'
text:
Click for more updates and latest
Hollywood News along with Bollywood and Entertainment updates. Also get latest news and top headlines from India and around the World at The Indian Express.
Selena Gomez developed a ‘face rash’ after kissing Benny Blanco for the first time: ‘I was so disgusting and repulsive’
Selena Gomez reveals she broke out in a face rash after Benny Blanco kissed her for the first time. He joked she was "allergic" to him and called himself
Entertainment DeskNew Delhi | May 1, 2025 06:02 IST
For all we can see, Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco can barely keep their hands off each other. Be it an award show, a red carpet gala, or a casual night out with friends, the two’s PDA-filled outings never miss a headline. But there was also a time when Gomez got a face rash after fiancé
Blanco kissed her for the first time when they started dating. The I Said I Love You First duo recently appeared on Jessie and Lennie Ware’s Table Manners podcast and didn’t shy away from sharing some juicy details about their earlier encounter, including the embarrassing one.
Also read:
 Benny Blanco learns fiancee Selena Gomez never went to prom; he makes it happen for her
Selena Gomez was so nervous during her first kiss, says Blanco
On Wednesday’s episode, the music producer revealed how the two were playing the “We’re Not Really Strangers” card game on their second date. This was back in mid-2023 when they had just started hanging out. They were chilling on the couch, and one of the prompts told them to take a selfie together. Selena leaned on Benny’s chest and snapped the photo, and the moment got a little more cosy than expected, to the point that Blanco just went for it. “I gotta kiss this girl,” he told her. So he did. And according to both of them, it was a really good kiss.
But right after the kiss, Selena’s body kinda betrayed her. “I kissed her right away, and her heart started beating so quickly, and she started getting a rash on her face … she was so nervous,” Blanco shared, laughing. Of course, that wasn’t the real reason. But the Table Manners podcast host joked if the singer was allergic to Blanco, and he replied again with, “She was, yeah. I was so disgusting and repulsive,” prompting Selena to hide her face in embarrassment.
Also read:
 Selena Gomez joins youngest billionaires club with an estimated net worth of USD 1.3 billion; that’s Rs 11000 crore
But, the Love On singer then explained she hadn’t truly liked anyone in a long time, not in that deep, emotional way. “Some kisses are just for fun,” she said. “But when you feel something behind it, it’s completely different.” For the unversed, Selena is quite a private person when it comes to dating, and the singer was not linked to anyone romantically for almost five years before going official with Benny Blanco—minus, as she put it, a few “shty dates here and there.” So when this kiss felt different, she didn’t know how to act. “I was a little embarrassed,” Selena admitted. “He asked, ‘Are you OK?’ And I was like, ‘No, no, I’m fine.’ I didn’t want to say, ‘I like you, I really like you.’”** And despite the awkwardness, according to the duo, that kiss actually kicked off everything.
From that day, things just felt easy between them. They kept dating, and Selena, who Benny called “so insane” about punctuality, would even show up to his house 20 to 30 minutes early for their dates, just to make sure she wasn’t late. “Her car would just be parked outside for like 30 minutes, and she would just wait until it was time to come in,” Blanco shared.
“I don’t think we’ve ever said that out loud to anyone, but it’s so funny,” Gomez said. “It’s just, I don’t know, I was nervous that I really liked him and I wanted to get there and, like, maybe call a friend to pump me up or do my makeup again or something.”
Benny and Selena first met in way back in 2013, through Selena’s mom. They later worked together on music like Kill Em With Kindness and “Same Old Love.” But the romance didn’t begin until much later. around mid-2023. They confirmed their relationship in December that year.
Click for more updates and latest

author: Zonebourse
title: Les succès de la défense antimissile dans le Golfe et en Ukraine renforcent l'urgence d'acquérir des systèmes au niveau mondial - Zonebourse
text:
Le succès des défenses antimissiles balistiques confrontées à leurs premiers scénarios de combat complexes et à fort enjeu en Israël, en mer Rouge et en Ukraine encouragera les armées du monde entier à investir dans ces systèmes coûteux, selon les experts, et intensifiera la course aux armements antimissiles. Selon des responsables américains et israéliens, l'Iran a lancé jusqu'à 120 missiles balistiques à portée intermédiaire en direction d'Israël le 13 avril. Les intercepteurs américains SM-3 et israéliens Arrow ont détruit la quasi-totalité de ces missiles, laissant les drones et les menaces plus petites au système Dôme de fer.
Au cours des mois précédents, des intercepteurs tirés à partir de destroyers de la marine américaine ont arrêté des missiles balistiques antinavires des Houthis, tandis qu'en Ukraine, des batteries Patriot MIM-104 fabriquées aux États-Unis ont abattu des missiles russes avancés Iskander et Khinzal.
Reuters s'est entretenu avec six experts qui ont déclaré que de plus en plus d'armées chercheraient à investir dans la défense antimissile balistique, ce qui représenterait une manne potentielle pour des entreprises telles que Lockheed Martin et Raytheon, qui construisent ce type de systèmes.
"Il est indéniable que tout pays riche disposant des moyens technologiques nécessaires continuera à investir dans la défense antimissile", a déclaré Ankit Panda, du Carnegie Endowment for International Peace, un groupe de réflexion sur la défense et la sécurité basé aux États-Unis. "Tout ceci est la recette d'une course aux armements conventionnels.
Des pays européens tels que les Pays-Bas, l'Allemagne, la Suède et la Pologne utilisent déjà les batteries Patriot de Raytheon, filiale de RTX, qui constituent le système occidental avancé de défense antimissile balistique le plus répandu.
L'Arabie saoudite utilise ses Patriot depuis des années pour se défendre contre les attaques des Houthis ; elle et les Émirats arabes unis exploitent également le système THAAD (Terminal High Altitude Air Defense) de Lockheed Martin. Le Koweït, le Qatar et le Bahreïn possèdent également des batteries de Patriot, et Oman a exprimé son intérêt pour la défense antimissile.
Aux États-Unis, Lockheed Martin a remporté en avril un contrat de 17,7 milliards de dollars pour un intercepteur de nouvelle génération destiné au programme GMD (Ground-Based Midcourse Defense), conçu pour abattre un petit nombre de missiles balistiques intercontinentaux (ICBM) visant la partie continentale des États-Unis.
Mais c'est en Asie, où la Chine a investi massivement dans des missiles balistiques à armement conventionnel, que l'impact pourrait être le plus important. Selon un rapport du Pentagone datant de 2023, la Force des fusées de l'Armée populaire de libération dispose d'environ 500 missiles DF-26, conçus pour frapper avec précision des cibles situées à des milliers de kilomètres.
Les bases américaines et alliées du Japon et de Guam se trouvent donc à portée d'une attaque qui ne peut être lancée qu'avec un préavis de 20 à 30 minutes.
"Dans le Pacifique, vous constaterez un intérêt accru pour la défense antimissile, ce qui poussera les Chinois à construire davantage de systèmes", a déclaré Jeffrey Lewis, directeur du programme de non-prolifération en Asie de l'Est au James Martin Center for Nonproliferation Studies de l'Institut Middlebury d'études internationales en Californie. "Les pays voudront acquérir des missiles (offensifs) parce qu'ils verront d'autres pays les utiliser [...]. Cela augmentera la demande de défenses antimissiles".
Le commandement américain pour l'Indo-Pacifique et le ministère chinois de la défense n'ont pas répondu aux demandes de commentaires.
La Chine parle rarement de son arsenal de missiles, se contentant de déclarer que ses forces sont destinées à préserver la paix et ne visent aucun pays en particulier.
Raytheon n'a pas répondu à une demande de commentaire. Un porte-parole de Lockheed Martin a renvoyé les questions à la présentation des résultats du premier trimestre, fin avril, dans laquelle la société a déclaré qu'elle restait à la tête de l'industrie dans les "missions de défense antimissile, qui, compte tenu des événements mondiaux, deviennent plus critiques que jamais".
SIGNES EN DOLLARS
La défense antimissile balistique consiste à repérer une arme attaquante au moment de son lancement ou en vol, puis à utiliser un radar de surface pour guider un intercepteur vers la cible.
Les interceptions peuvent avoir lieu dans l'atmosphère ou dans l'espace, et chaque domaine nécessite un matériel différent. Par exemple, les ailerons ne fonctionnent pas en dehors de l'atmosphère : les intercepteurs doivent être équipés de petites fusées de direction pour fonctionner dans l'espace.
Les ordinateurs puissants, les radars à longue portée et les missiles de la taille d'un poteau de téléphone nécessaires ne sont pas bon marché et se chiffrent en milliards. En 2022, par exemple, les États-Unis ont approuvé la vente de Patriots et de systèmes THAAD à l'Arabie saoudite, pour un montant de 5,3 milliards de dollars.
Dans la région indo-pacifique, les pays les plus riches tels que le Japon, l'Australie et la Corée du Sud sont des candidats de choix pour la défense antimissile, a déclaré M. Lewis, alors que presque tous les pays d'Asie investissent déjà dans les missiles.
Le ministère japonais de la défense a déclaré que le pays "doit fondamentalement et rapidement renforcer ses capacités de défense, y compris la défense aérienne et antimissile intégrée". Il a indiqué qu'il investissait dans des missiles Patriot améliorés, de meilleurs radars et des capacités navales antimissiles renforcées.
Dans son dernier budget de défense, la Corée du Sud a augmenté de 12 % le financement de son système de défense aérienne et antimissile coréen afin de l'étendre "à partir du concept de défense de niveau inférieur existant", a déclaré le ministère de la défense du pays dans un communiqué.
Des cas tels que le conflit entre Israël et le Hamas et la guerre entre la Russie et l'Ukraine ont réaffirmé l'importance d'un "système de défense contre les missiles balistiques" pour répondre à des menaces de missiles de plus en plus sophistiquées", a déclaré le ministère.
À la mi-avril, l'Australie a annoncé la signature d'un contrat de 500 millions de dollars australiens (328 millions de dollars) avec Lockheed Martin pour la livraison de son système de gestion conjointe de la bataille aérienne (Joint Air Battle Management System), qui permet de suivre et de détruire les avions et les missiles.
Le coût d'un missile balistique est souvent bien inférieur à celui du système destiné à l'arrêter.
Mais ce n'est pas la bonne façon de considérer les coûts, a déclaré Yoji Koda, ancien commandant en chef de la flotte d'autodéfense japonaise et partisan d'un renforcement des défenses antimissiles dans son pays.
"Dans une économie de guerre, moins c'est cher, mieux c'est. Mais parfois, ce qui est nécessaire, c'est de protéger les infrastructures clés ou les centres de commandement clés, à n'importe quel prix. Car sans eux, nous serions perdants.
LA QUESTION DE LA CHINE
La plupart des missiles balistiques à armement conventionnel de la Chine sont conçus pour atteindre des cibles terrestres.
Mais la Chine dispose également d'ogives orientables destinées à frapper des navires en mer, notamment le DF-21D et des variantes du DF-26, développées par la société d'État China Aerospace Science and Technology Corporation.
Ces missiles balistiques antinavires (ASBM) n'avaient jamais été utilisés au combat jusqu'à la fin de l'année 2023, lorsque les forces houthies du Yémen ont commencé à tirer des modèles de fabrication iranienne sur des navires en mer Rouge.
Entre novembre - la première utilisation documentée - et avril, le Commandement central des États-Unis a signalé au moins 85 ASBM tirés dans la région, 20 interceptions et un navire civil coulé.
Le CENTCOM a refusé de donner des précisions sur l'efficacité des ASBM iraniens, mais a noté que les missiles ne présentant aucune menace n'ont pas été engagés et que la plupart de ceux qui n'ont pas été interceptés ont atterri sans dommage.
L'efficacité des défenses antimissiles sur terre et en mer attirera l'attention de la Chine, a déclaré Tong Zhao, chercheur principal du programme de politique nucléaire et de Carnegie China.
"Cela soulève la possibilité que les États-Unis et leurs alliés dépendent de manière significative de la défense antimissile contre une attaque de missiles balistiques", a déclaré M. Zhao.
Bien que les spécificités techniques des missiles chinois soient tenues secrètes, les investissements importants consentis par le pays signifient qu'ils sont probablement plus fiables et que l'on pense généralement qu'ils utilisent des contre-mesures complexes pour compliquer l'interception.
"Pour des adversaires tels que la Chine, qui disposent de stocks de missiles d'un ordre de grandeur supérieur à ceux de la Russie ou de l'Iran et qui utilisent des systèmes plus sophistiqués, il n'est pas certain que les enseignements tirés invalident les constructions opérationnelles existantes", a déclaré Sidarth Kaushal, chargé de recherche principal au Royal United Services Institute.
Mais les incitations politiques et pratiques à investir dans la défense antimissile seront trop attrayantes pour que de nombreux pays les ignorent, selon M. Lewis.
"Toutes les décisions en matière d'acquisition de matériel de défense sont en fin de compte des questions politiques", a-t-il déclaré. "La politique dans ce domaine est très simple : voulez-vous défendre le pays ou non ? Et la réponse gagnante est toujours 'oui'". (1 $ = 1,5225 dollar australien)

author: HANIS MAKETAB
title: Malaysian artist creates more than colourful paintings in a political age | The Star
text:
For an art exhibition titled Distopia, at first glance, Hisyamuddin Abdullah’s pieces look quite the opposite of dystopic. But his use of light colours and tones belie a deeper meaning.
“The title of a show plays a pivotal role, because to me, it is what piques the interest of visitors and draws them in to view the artwork within. For this show, I decided to go with Distopia. But it is by no means meant to provoke – it’s more of me questioning how one’s view of something can be the opposite of what it really is,” says Hisyamuddin, 34.
Distopia, the artist’s third solo exhibition, is showing at Sareng Gallery in Kuala Lumpur until Jan 13.
“I also wanted to invite people to imagine and examine what is hidden behind the layers of bright and harmonious colours in my work. Just because something looks beautiful on the outside, doesn’t make it beautiful on the inside,” he points out.
'Don’t Point The Ball At Me! 2' (acrylic on canvas, 2023). Photo: Sareng Gallery
Born and raised in the small coastal village of Marang, Terengganu, Hisyamuddin says that politics act as a narrative for his works.
“One of the biggest inspirations for my artwork comes from Malaysia’s oft-tumultuous political scene, which tends to be a roller-coaster of surprises. It was able to capture my attention and was translated into my work through symbols and metaphors,” he shares.
“For example, a recurring symbol that I used in my pieces is a transparent pyramid, which is meant to represent transparency in administration. I also used animals such as mules, turtles and snakes as metaphors – not to portray any particular individuals, but to highlight certain characteristics as a form of criticism towards the prevalent practices of our society that go against the values of a civilised society.”
A balancing act
In his essay “Politics Subdued”, Dr Zakaria Ali comments that there are two ways to paint politics.
“One is direct, as we have seen in Hisyamuddin’s earlier artworks. The other is indirect, as we see in his current body of artworks.
'Throne Of Glass' (acrylic on canvas, 2023). Photo: Sareng Gallery
“There are threads of decorum, courtesy and respect in the way Hisyamuddin weaves his composition. (His) artworks call for the return to true governance, one as trustworthy as the pinks and blues of his colour spread,” writes Zakaria.
And indeed, Hisyamuddin says that in his latest works, he focused on a new concept that is something of a departure from his previous works.
“In this series, I focused more on the concept of ‘balance’, most noticeably in the use of harmonious colours.
“I also applied new skills and techniques that I’ve acquired, such as the way I handled the paintbrush to get an even effect on the surface of the canvas and applying a more accurate use of visual measurements.”
According to Hisyamuddin, as an artist, one of the biggest challenges he faces is in maintaining the quality of his work over time, particularly in technical and creative aspects.
“An artist should also always be aware of the current state of the world if they want their work to grow in pace with the changes in society and remain relevant. That is another major challenge that I always try to consider,” he concludes.
Distopia is showing at Sareng Gallery, Menara Chan, Jalan Ampang in Kuala Lumpur until Jan 13. The gallery is open Monday to Saturday, 10am-5.30 pm. It is closed on public holidays. Admission is free.
Open Modal ×

author: MarketScreener
title: Tech Down as Retreat From Chipmakers Continues -- Tech Roundup - MarketScreener
text:
Shares of technology companies fell as traders continued to retreat from chip stocks.
The chip sub sector has not participated in the stock-market surge that followed the election of Donald Trump, said one strategist. "The thing that comes up with lot of these firms is what happens with China?" said JJ Kinahan, chief executive of IG Market North America and president of its brokerage tastytrade. "It's going to be interesting to see where and if tariffs are started or increased and how."
Kinahan cited the outsized rally in domestically focused indexes such as the Russell 2000 as evidence that many investors "clearly believes it's going to be a full America-first agenda."
The European Commission fined Meta Platforms the equivalent of around $843 million, saying it tied its classified-ads platform to its flagship social network, Facebook, undermining competition.
A surge in bitcoin prices has likely gained momentum as traders eye the $100,000 level, said Kinahan. While these round numbers have little significance in technical market analysis, the level is a major psychological milestone long discussed in cryptocurrency circles, said Kinahan.
Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com
(END) Dow Jones Newswires
11-14-24 1752ET
Share © Dow Jones - 2024

author: Jessica Lyons
title: Mitel 0-day, 5-year-old Oracle RCE bug under active exploit
text:
3 CVEs added to CISA's catalog Cybercriminals are actively exploiting two vulnerabilities in Mitel MiCollab, including a zero-day flaw – and a critical remote code execution vulnerability in Oracle WebLogic Server that has been abused for at least five years.
Here are the three, all of which the US Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) added to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog based on evidence of active exploitation:
CVE-2024-41713 Mitel MiCollab Path Traversal Vulnerability: Patch available, data leakage or deletion possible by unauthenticated users
CVE-2024-55550 Mitel MiCollab Path Traversal Vulnerability: Patch not available, data leakage to authenticated admin users
CVE-2020-2883 Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability: Patch available, remote-code execution through deserialization
Two of the three – Mitel's CVE-2024-41713, and Oracle's CVE-2020-2883 – have been fixed by the respective vendors, while CVE-2024-55550 remains in flux; security researchers have sounded warnings for months about these Mitel bugs and for years about Oracle's.
It goes without saying, but if you haven't already: Get patching ASAP, if you can. Miscreants have a head start in this race.
The two Mitel flaws affect the vendor's MiCollab product in versions 9.8 SP1 FP2 (9.8.1.201) and earlier. Both are path traversal vulnerabilities, with one (CVE-2024-41713) receiving a critical 9.8 CVSS rating and the other (CVE-2024-55550) a low-severity 2.7 score.
MiCollab is a widely used enterprise collaboration tool with a range of features including voice, video, chat messaging, SMS, web…
Jessica Lyons

author: Kelli Miller
title: Rose Bath Soak Recipe
text: Rose Bath Soak Recipe Creating your Rose bath soak recipe is a luxurious way to unwind and pamper yourself. Picture stepping into a warm, rose-scented bath, where each petal soothes your senses and refreshes your spirit. Plus, this luxurious soak turns your bathroom into a tranquil haven and lets you enjoy essential oils’ natural benefits. Incorporating [recipes using essential oils](https://3boysandadog.com/recipes-using-essential-oils/) into your self-care routine allows for natural and relaxing treatments that nourish both body and mind. By embracing the power of nature’s finest ingredients, you can elevate your self-care rituals to new heights, leaving you feeling refreshed and blissfully relaxed. Join us as we explore how to create this luxurious bath experience at home, using simple, natural ingredients that transform ordinary moments into extraordinary escapes. Why Make Your Own Rose Bath Soak? Creating your Rose bath soak at home offers several compelling benefits. First and foremost, the use of natural ingredients is a significant advantage. Avoiding synthetic additives and chemicals ensures that your bath soak is as pure and gentle as possible. This customization allows you to tailor the ingredients to suit your preferences and specific skin types, ensuring a personalized and skin-friendly experience. Whether you prefer a stronger rose scent or a more subtle aroma, the choice is yours. In addition to the personal customization, making your rose bath soak is incredibly cost-effective. Store-bought bath soaks, especially those marketed as luxurious or premium, often come with a hefty price tag. Making your own at home gives you a luxurious experience without extra cost. Also, bath soak ingredients are cheaper, and you can produce bigger batches, saving money over time. Sustainability is another key benefit of DIY rose bath soaks. You can significantly reduce your environmental impact by choosing eco-friendly ingredients and using sustainable packaging options. This conscious choice benefits the planet and aligns with a growing desire for more sustainable living practices. By reusing jars or opting for biodegradable packaging, you ensure that your self-care routine is as green as it is soothing. Embrace these benefits and enjoy a guilt-free, luxurious bathing experience that nurtures you and the environment. Shop My Kitchen: The following items can be found in my kitchen here at Miller Manor. Simply click the image that interests you – yes, they do contain affiliate links. Benefits of Rose Essential Oil Immerse yourself in the soothing world of aromatherapy with a rose bath soak. The calming scent of roses envelops your senses, creating a serene escape from the stresses of everyday life. The gentle rose fragrance relaxes your mind and eases stress. Also, as you inhale the aroma, tension disappears, making you calmer and centered. Beyond its enchanting scent, a rose bath soak offers remarkable skincare benefits. Roses’ natural properties help to hydrate and soothe the skin, leaving it feeling soft, supple, and rejuvenated. As you soak, your skin absorbs the nourishing elements, promoting a healthy glow and enhancing your natural radiance. It’s a simple yet effective way to give your skin the care and attention it deserves. The mood-enhancing qualities of a rose bath soak shouldn’t be overlooked. The soothing scent relaxes the body and uplifts the spirit, creating a sense of peace and well-being. Whether you’re unwinding after a long day or simply taking a moment for yourself, the mood-boosting effects of a rose-infused bath can transform your outlook, promoting relaxation and a positive mindset. Best Practices for Using Rose Bath Soak To maximize the benefits of your rose bath soak, follow these practical application tips. Add 1/4 cup of the soak to a warm bath, stirring until the mixture is fully dissolved. This allows the ingredients to disperse evenly, creating an inviting and aromatic bathing experience. For optimal results, immerse yourself in the bath for at least 20 minutes. This time allows your body to absorb the nourishing and calming properties of the soak, leaving you feeling refreshed and revitalized. Keeping your bath soak fresh and potent is crucial. So, store it in an airtight container to shield it from moisture and air. Plus, this ensures your soak is always ready for a relaxing escape. Safety is paramount, so keep your bath soak out of the reach of children and pets. Additionally, if you have sensitive skin, perform a patch test before your first use. Apply a small amount of the soak to a skin patch and wait to ensure no adverse reaction. Taking these precautions lets you enjoy your rose bath soak with peace of mind, knowing you’re using it safely and effectively. How to Make Rose Bath Soak Where to Get Quality Ingredients Sourcing high-quality ingredients is crucial to achieving the best results when crafting your luxurious rose bath soak. Rocky Mountain Oils is a trusted source of premium essential oils and ingredients that elevate your bath soak experience. Known for their unwavering commitment to quality and purity, Rocky Mountain Oils ensures that each product is carefully tested and crafted to meet the highest standards. The Essentialist’s Handbook Natural essential oils, which are inexpensive and wonderfully powerful, can be life-changing. Check out [The Essentialist’s Handbook—A Beginners Guide to Essential Oils eBook ](https://shop.3boysandadog.com/product/the-essentialists-handbook)today! More Handmade Beauty Products: [Cucumber Melon Soap Recipe](https://3boysandadog.com/cucumber-melon-soap-recipe/)[Jasmine Bath Salts](https://3boysandadog.com/jasmine-aromatherapy-bath-salts/)[Jojoba Bead Layered Soap](https://3boysandadog.com/diy-jojoba-bead-layered-soap/)[Gingerbread Soap Recipe](https://3boysandadog.com/easy-diy-gingerbread-soap-recipe/)[Neroli Bath Bombs Recipe](https://3boysandadog.com/diy-neroli-bath-bombs-recipe/) DIY Rose Bath Soak Recipe This DIY Rose Bath Soap Recipe proves that you can create your own relaxing spa day at home! Materials - 1 cup Epsom salts - 1/2 cup sea salt - 10 drops rose essential oil - 1/4 cup dried rose petals Instructions - Mix salts and rose petals in a bowl. - Add rose essential oil and stir well. - Store in an airtight container. - Add 1/4 cup to a warm bath. Connect with fellow bath soak enthusiasts and inspire others by posting your experiences and photos. Enjoy the fun and refreshing benefits of your personalized, eco-friendly bath soak!

author: Karen Asp
title: How to Get Calcium on a Vegan Diet (Plus, 6 Foods to Keep Your Bones Strong)
text:
How many times have you heard that you need to drink milk for strong bones? While your body does need calcium, there are better—and healthier—sources of calcium that come without the harmful effects of dairy. The marketing promoting milk and its “superior” calcium content is severely misleading. The truth is, you can get enough calcium on a vegan diet by eating calcium-rich foods.
How much calcium do I need?
Your calcium needs depend on your age and sex, says Stacie Hassing, RDN, LD, co-founder of The Real Food Dietitians, and co-author of
The Real Food Table. The average adult needs roughly 1,000 milligrams of calcium per day.
Jeeca Uy
Yet, for women over the age of 50 and men over 71, that jumps to 1,200 milligrams per day. One point to remember? “Vitamin D is necessary for the absorption of calcium to take place in the body, which is why some foods like orange juice, milk, and some
breakfast cereals are fortified with calcium and vitamin D,” she says.
Despite the incessant promotion of milk for its vitamin D content, this isn’t natural. All the vitamin D in cow’s milk is fortified, just as it is with many types of
plant-based milk.
Calcium health benefits
One of calcium’s best-known benefits is maintaining and building strong bones and teeth, but it’s important for many other functions in your body. “Your heart, muscles, nerves, and circulatory system all require calcium to function properly,” Hassing says.
No doubt, maintaining healthy bone strength is important. Yes, it can help prevent broken and fractured bones when we have an accident, but it’s not just falling that can cause damage to our bones. Osteoporosis and osteopenia (the early onset of osteoporosis) cause the weakening and brittleness of bones.
Canva
The disease tends to occur in older adults as humans lose bone mass as they age (starting in their thirties), but those first three decades of your life are opportunities to build a strong foundation to prevent osteoporosis.
Approximately 10 million Americans over the age of 50 suffer from the disease, but another 43 million have been diagnosed with osteopenia or low bone mass. While other lifestyle choices can be preventative (such as regular
weight-bearing exercise), getting enough calcium surely helps.
Can you get calcium without milk?
A plethora of whole foods contain calcium, but some are significantly higher than others. It’s true that there is a significant amount of calcium in some animal products including cow’s milk, yogurt, sardines, and canned salmon with bones. However, an abundance of plant-based foods are also high in calcium.
“You can get all of the calcium you need from a vegetarian or vegan diet,” assures Dr. Robert Graham, Chief Health Officer for Performance Kitchen and co-founder of FRESH Med in New York City.
What’s more, the calcium found in many plant-based foods such as dark leafy greens is more bioavailable than the calcium found in milk. The body absorbs approximately 33 percent of the total calcium in dairy, but a whopping 62 percent of the calcium in broccoli is absorbed upon digestion.
Other high-calcium plant-based foods include
tofu, fortified nut milks, beans, kale, tahini, sweet potatoes, watercress, okra, chia seeds, and almonds, Graham says. You can also find many calcium-fortified orange juices and cereals at the supermarket.
6 vegan sources of calcium
While the list of calcium-containing plant foods is long, Hassing offers some of the best sources for vegans.
Canva
1 Nuts and seeds
When deciding between nut kinds of butter, opt for the almond to get the most calcium. While many
nuts and seeds contain modest amounts of calcium, almonds reign supreme at 75 milligrams per 30-gram serving (about 20 almonds).
Hazelnuts come in at a decent 56 milligrams per serving, and while slightly lower at 42 milligrams per serving, tahini is a versatile and delicious way to up the calcium intake of any meal.
Canva
2 Amaranth
Swap out the quinoa with some amaranth from time to time. With 80 grams of calcium per one-quarter cup (dry), this ancient grain adds antioxidants, fiber, and a boost of calcium to any Buddha bowl. We also love to swap out a morning bowl of oats for this
berry and almond amaranth porridge.
Canva
3 Beans
White beans (navy beans), kidney beans, and chickpeas are the calcium powerhouses of legumes. Navy beans top the charts at 132 milligrams of calcium per one-cup serving, and kidney beans and chickpeas follow with 93 and 99 milligrams, respectively. Use all three in a deliciously hearty combination of
vegan chili.
Canva
4 Minimally processed soy
Tofu,
tempeh, and edamame are all stellar sources of vegan calcium.
Just one three-ounce serving of tofu clocks in 10-percent of the daily recommended amount of calcium, while tempeh supplies about 6-percent of what you need (78 milligrams per 2.5-ounce serving). One cup of edamame provides about 9-percent of the daily recommended amount.
Soy milk is also a solid option. Not only does it naturally contain calcium, but many are also fortified with up to one-third of the calcium you need per day (that’s the same as cow’s milk).
Canva
5 Blackstrap molasses
We wouldn’t recommend consuming a spoonful of molasses to fulfill your daily calcium needs, but this sticky substance can be incorporated in small amounts into a medley of delicious dishes.
Try whipping up a batch of nutty
muhammara dip or baking a batch of this addictive pecan-walnut cinnamon granola. Just one tablespoon of the stuff contains 200 milligrams of calcium—20-percent of what most adults need each day!
Canva
6 Dark leafy greens
There are countless reasons to up your greens intake—calcium just happens to be among them. A humble 120 grams of broccoli (a little over a cup) delivers 112 milligrams of calcium, and the typically underutilized okra contains 77 milligrams for the same amount.
Other dark leafy greens such as kale, collard greens, and bok choy also contain some calcium, though not quite as much as these two options.
What about vegan calcium supplements?
You may need to supplement if a blood test shows that you’re low in calcium. Yet because the standard American diet is 65-percent processed foods, Graham generally recommends supplementation for most Americans, especially women over the age of 50. “Calcium is absorbed best when you take 500 milligrams or less at one time,” he says, adding that current recommendations call for 1000 milligrams to 2000 milligrams in divided doses, ideally taken with vitamin D.
The only way to tell if you’re chronically low in calcium is through a blood test, Hassing says. Signs that you might be low in calcium include muscle cramping, brittle nails, easy hair breakage, poor circulation that causes tingling and numbness in your fingers and toes, and an irregular heartbeat.
If you’re concerned that your levels are low, talk with your doctor about getting a blood test. For most vegans, Graham recommends eating foods high in calcium and/or taking a calcium supplement to get all that you need.

title: Nico Williams erklärt Athletic-Bilbao-Verbleib trotz Interesse des FC Bayern und FC Barcelona: "Verein meines Lebens" - Fußball Video - Eurosport
text: Nico Williams hat seinen Vertrag bei Athletic Bilbao bis 2035 verlängert. Der spanische Nationalspieler erklärt seine Entscheidung für den Verbleib trotz des Interesses vom FC Bayern München und dem FC Barcelona-
